title: TC003-JSON Formatter Tool - Valid JSON Input
description: Verify JSON Formatter tool formats, minifies, and validates syntactically correct JSON data with syntax highlighting.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on JSON Formatter tool link to open the JSON Formatter tool.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on JSON Formatter tool link to open the JSON Formatter tool. 
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/div/div/div/div[2]/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000) 
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=JSON Formatting Failed: Invalid Syntax Detected').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: JSON Formatter tool did not format, minify, or validate the JSON data as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: Test execution timed out after 15 minutes

title: TC005-JWT Decoder Tool - Decode Valid Token
description: Verify that the JWT Decoder correctly decodes Header, Payload, and expiration time from a valid JWT token.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the JWT Decoder tool link to open the JWT Decoder.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the JWT Decoder tool link to open the JWT Decoder. 
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/aside/div/div/div/div[2]/div[4]/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000) 
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Decoded JWT Token Invalid Output').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The JWT Decoder did not correctly decode Header, Payload, and expiration time from the valid JWT token as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC011-Theme Toggle - Dark and Light Mode
description: Verify that the theme toggle switches between dark and light modes and persists the selection.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click the Theme Toggle widget to switch to dark mode.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the Theme Toggle widget to switch to dark mode.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/main/header/button[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Reload the page to verify that dark mode persists.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Toggle back to light mode and verify the UI changes accordingly.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the Theme Toggle widget to switch back to light mode.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/main/header/button[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Web Toolkit - 44+ Developer Tools').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=All-in-One Developer Toolkit to format, convert, encode, and generate with powerful browser-based tools. No installation, no signup, 100% private.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: Test execution timed out after 15 minutes

title: TC012-Command Menu Global Search and Navigation
description: Verify that the Command Menu opens with Cmd+K, allows searching for tools and commands, and navigates correctly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Type a partial tool name 'JSON' in the Command Menu search input.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Type 'JSON' in the Command Menu search input to filter tools.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[7]/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('JSON')
        

        # -> Select 'JSON Formatter' from the Command Menu suggestions and press Enter to navigate.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Select 'JSON Formatter' from the Command Menu suggestions.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[7]/div/div[2]/div/div[2]/div[2]/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Command Menu Opened Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The Command Menu did not open or function as expected. The test plan requires opening the Command Menu with Cmd+K, searching for tools like 'JSON', and navigating correctly, but this did not occur.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
